8/ And sprinkling in a little Peter Lynch, how are you supposed to "buy what you know," if you don't know anything at all about using #crypto ?
7/ Put another way, if wish you had been able to participate in crafting the birth of the Web, then #crypto is your second shot with an added dose of cantankerousness (yes, it's a word).
6/ Certainly, you can hold through the next few #crypto cycles and likely come out just fine, but you'd be missing the best part of helping to re-design the Web.
5/ On a personal basis, I would say it's *critical* that you use & play with different components of the #crypto -stack. It's way more fun than just speculating

4/ We'll see a similar alignment between financial markets and mainstream adoption over the coming decades in #crypto , as people go behind investing & speculating and actually use the networks being created.
